rules: Rule1: If the monitoring station is active, then realtime data is streaming.
Rule2: If the seismic network is operational, then the gas sensors are calibrated.
Rule3: Either the seismic network is operational or the GPS stations are functioning.
Rule4: Given that the GPS stations are functioning, should realtime data be streaming, then an eruption is predicted to be imminent.
Rule5: If the data center is processing, then provided the gas sensors are calibrated, whenever realtime data is streaming, an eruption is predicted to be imminent.
Rule6: Under the condition that the power supply is stable, the data center is processing.
Rule7: If the emergency protocol is activated, then a manual alert has been issued.
Rule8: Either the evacuation team is ready or the response units have been mobilized.
Rule9: If the response units have been mobilized, then provided that it is not the case that an eruption is predicted to be imminent, the emergency protocol is activated.
Rule10: Provided that the radio network is operational, the communications system is functional.
Rule11: The radio network is operational or the satellite link is active.

Rule12: If the satellite link is active, then given the evacuation team is ready, under the condition that it is not the case that an eruption is predicted to be imminent, the emergency protocol is activated.
Rule13: If magma movement has been detected, then pressure is building at the vent.
Rule14: Given that gas emission has increased, if pressure is building at the vent, then it is not the case that evacuation has been ordered for zone A.
Rule15: Either gas emission has increased or a thermal anomaly is present.
Rule16: If satellite data is available, then infrasound has been detected indicating eruption.
Rule17: Either satellite data is available or ground deformation has been measured.
Rule18: Provided that ground deformation has been measured, should a thermal anomaly be present, then if pressure is building at the vent, evacuation has not been ordered for zone A.

Rule19: If infrasound has been detected indicating eruption, then given a thermal anomaly is present, under the condition that pressure is building at the vent, it is not the case that evacuation has been ordered for zone A.
Rule20: If it is not the case that whenever it is not the case that an eruption is predicted to be imminent then seismic activity is high, then evacuation has been ordered for zone A.
Rule21: Provided that it is not the case that if it is not the case that an eruption is predicted to be imminent then seismic activity is high, magma movement has been detected.
Rule22: If it is not the case that the power supply is stable, then the backup generator has failed.
Rule23: Under the condition that it is not the case that an eruption is predicted to be imminent, it is not the case that a manual alert has been issued.
facts: Fact1: The monitoring station is active.
Fact2: It is not the case that seismic activity is high.
Fact3: The backup generator has not failed.
Fact4: It is not the case that the communications system is functional.

question: An eruption is predicted to be imminent.
